news.title: Storm Bram: 54,000 without power as high winds persist; trains suspended in parts of Dublin and major disruption to road and air travel
Drugs gang linked to Offaly arson deaths are suspects in at least two other murders
news.summary: The net is closing in on the gang responsible for the petrol bomb attack that led to the murders of a four-year-old boy and his 60-year-old great-aunt as gardaí continue to receive more information about the shocking crime.

news.title: Enoch Burke ‘clearly has something to hide’ about his income, judge says
news.summary: A judge has said it is clear from Enoch Burke’s refusal to disclose information about his income and expenditure that he has “something to hide”.

news.title: Punk rap duo Bob Vylan sue RTÉ for defamation over coverage of controversial Glastonbury set
news.summary: A British music group has issued defamation proceedings against RTÉ over the broadcaster’s coverage of their controversial appearance at the Glastonbury Festival.

news.title: Taoiseach rejects ambassador’s denial of Russian involvement in drones over Dublin Bay during Zelensky visit
news.summary: The Taoiseach, Micheál Martin, has rejected the Russian Ambassador’s claim that his country was not connected to the drones that were spotted over Dublin Bay during the visit of the Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's last week.

news.title: Martin Breheny: GAA coaches could learn a lot from how Andy Farrell goes about his business
news.summary: It was so straightforward and sensible I had to read it twice, just to make sure.

news.title: How soaring cattle prices brought down a €16m Munster cattle-buying firm
news.summary: The news that Nicholas Galvin Ltd, a major dairy and beef finishing firm based in Kilmacthomas, Co Waterford, entered provisional liquidation in November sent ripples through the cattle sector.

news.title: Art world in mourning as internationally renowned artist killed in Carlow crash – ‘She was an exceptionally talented lady’
news.summary: The art world is in mourning following the sudden and tragic loss of an internationally renowned artist following a crash in Co Carlow.

news.title: First Look: Inside Guinness’s new London brewery – ‘stouties’, baby pints, and a tour with tasting flights
news.summary: “Look at the state of that Guinness!”

news.title: Kirsty Blake Knox: Meghan Markle’s estrangement from her father has taken another tragic turn
news.summary: Back in May 2018 I was sent to Slough to cover what was being described as the wedding of the year. In the neighbouring town of Windsor, Meghan Markle and Prince Harry were set to get married.
